3.m: And the Lord God made for Adam and for his wife garments of skins and clothed them. - Genesis 3:21 (ESV)

l.q: How did the man and the woman disobey the LORD God?
l.a: The woman disobeyed God by listening to the serpent instead of following God's command. She saw that the tree was good for food, it was a delight to the eyes, and it will make her wise. She ate its fruit and gave her husband who also ate.

l.q: How did the man and the woman's disobedience affect their relationship with God?
l.a: The man and the woman became afraid of God. They realized that they have sinned before God and were ashamed of their nakedness. Because they sinned, they were separated from God who is Holy.

l.q: What were the consequences of the man's and woman's disobedience to God?
l.a: The man and the woman will experience pain and suffering. They and their children will never be able to go back to the Garden of Eden. They will have to live in an imperfect world.

l.q: How did God provide for Adam and Eve before He drove them out from the garden?
l.a: God made for them garments of skins and clothed them.
